meanings.definition: preshows: plural noun - performances or events that occur before the main show
meanings.sent1: The preshows at the carnival included magic tricks and juggling acts.
meanings.sent2: We always look forward to the preshows before the circus performance.
meanings.sent3: The preshows at the talent show got the audience excited for the main acts.
meanings.sent4: The preshows were like appetizers, preparing us for the feast of the main show.
meanings.sent5: The colorful preshows made the entire event more vibrant and entertaining.

meanings.definition: preshows: verb - to present or introduce something before the main event
meanings.sent1: The host preshows the guest speaker before the conference begins.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to preshows the opening act to warm up the audience.
meanings.sent3: The magician preshows his grand finale trick to build anticipation.
meanings.sent4: She preshows the new product features to the customers for feedback.
meanings.sent5: The teacher preshows the lesson plan to the students to give them an overview.
